body.p: To the honourable T E Bramlett governor of Kentucky the undersigned petitioners would respectfully represent unto your Excellency that at the last (the March) term of the Taylor Circuit Court, one John Hosh was fined fifty dollars and 20 days imprisonment in the County Jail, the offence charged was a breach of the peace, for going with some other persons (2 in no) to a neighbours house to get some whiskey and as they went to the house one of the party (not Hosh) shot a dog in the yard, and also made some noise, we would represent unto your honour that said Hosh is a poor man, has to work for his living, has a family to support and it requires all that he can make to support his family and believing as we do that Hosh intended nothing rong by going with the others to get the whiskey, we would respectfully petition your Excellincy to remit the fine & imprisonment.

J. W. Overstreet
D B Moore
Thos. E. Cowherd

To his Excellency T. E. Bramlette
Governor of Ky

I understand ^from good authority that^ the Statement in the foregoing Petition in regard to the alledged shooting & disturbance is true, I knew Mr Hosh is a poor man, with a large family, depending on him for Support, and that the he is unable to lose the ammount of the fine, and or the time, of 20 days imprisonment, and would therefore respectfully, reccommend the remission of Said fine and imprisonment

very respectfully
your obdt Servant
J. H. Chandler
J B Bearns
J. D. Williams
Crom Hoskins
Alexander Willson
Mr Overstreet one of the Signers of the petition was the prosecution in the case, and,

Taylor Cir Ct
vs
John Hosh
$50.
20 days Impmt
19th May/65
